summary: "OK Computer" is the third album by English rock band Radiohead, released in 1997. They recorded it in Oxfordshire and Bath, moving away from their earlier guitar-focused sound. The album explores themes like consumerism, technology, and isolation, predicting 21st-century issues. Radiohead used unique recording techniques, and the album was mostly recorded live. Despite initial doubts from their label, it became a huge success, topping charts in the UK and expanding their global popularity. It won awards, influenced British rock to become more alternative, and is considered one of the greatest albums ever.
title: OK Computer
